Eve raises an interesting point! There are some historical theories about why certain countries drive on one side of the road versus the other. One popular theory is that it has to do with the dominant hand used by people in those societies. In many parts of the world where right-hand drive is the norm, it's thought that people were historically more likely to use their right hand for tasks like carrying weapons or steering animals. This might have led to a natural preference for driving on the left side of the road to keep the dominant hand closer to the edge of the road for better control and visibility.

Of course, these are just theories, and the actual reasons are likely complex and varied. There could be other factors like ancient trade routes, the layout of cities, or even just random chance that played a role. It's a fascinating topic to explore!
